html:
2013 Georgetown Holiday Window Dressing Competition

The Georgetown Business Improvement Districts's (BID) 2nd Annual Holiday Window Competition is well underway with many Georgetown merchants from design, fashion and food decorating their storefronts for the holiday season.

Oak Hill Cemetery Wrapping Up Chapel Work

By Katie PearceCurrent Staff Writer

The largest restoration project in decades at Georgetown’s Oak Hill Cemetery is now finishing up, replacing the roof of the small 1853 chapel designed by James W. Renwick Jr.

Fairmont's 10th Annual Tree Lighting Ceremony December 3

Join Fairmont, Washington D.C., Georgetown in celebrating their annual Tree Lighting Ceremnony, December 3 from 5:30 to 7:00 pm. This free event, open to the public benefits the U.S. Marine's Toys for Tots Program.

Swedish Holiday Bazaar December 7

Swedish Women's Education Association (SWEA) Annual Holiday Bazaar at House of Sweden is Saturday, December 7, 2013 from 11:00 am to 5:00 pm.
Eno Wine Room Delights the Senses
'Go Nuts With the Clyde's Nutcrackers'

Fete Des Lumieres Georgetown Will Light Up Holiday Season December 13-20

International festival makes U.S. debut in Georgetown with public art and light installations.

Meet Your New Neighbors, Georgetown

We lost The Guards, Mie N Yu, and Third Edition but we gained Tory Burch, El Centro, The Frye Company, Capitol Prague and Billy Reid, to name a few.

Knocked Out!

It’s kinda fun watching some of our most accomplished hometown girls out of control – such was the case at the 20th Anniversary celebration of Knock Out Abuse, founded by Cheryl Masri and Jill Sorenson.

Cathedral of St. Matthew the Apostle Commemorates JFK

The Cathedral of Saint Matthew the Apostle is observing the 50th anniversary of the death of President John F. Kennedy throughout the month of November.

'Mirage' Opening Reception at Susan Calloway November 22

Friday evening visit Susan Calloway Fine Arts Gallery from 6:00 to 8:00 pm for the opening reception of Mirage: David Ivan Clark. This painting exhibition will run through December 21, 2013.

'If/Then' at the National Theater

I went to see If/Then at the National Theater and did understand I was going to see a pre-Broadway try-out of a new musical. I left thinking spending $110 for the privilege seemed a little much.

Turkey Out This Thanksgiving?

Follow the tradition of the first Plymouth Rock Pilgrims and eat out this year.

Gypsy Sally’s in Line for Rare Tavern License in Georgetown

By Katie PearceCurrent Staff Writer

A rarely available tavern license is up for grabs in Georgetown, and Gypsy Sally’s is first in line for it.
Eric Gray Small Paintings at Gallery Chez M

Shop Local Week Starts November 30

Think Local First DC, Old Town Boutique District and Causetown are partnering to host Shop Local Week 2013, promoting independently owned, community-minded businesses as the preferred option for holiday shoppers.

Architects for Animals 'Giving Shelter' December 5

Architects for Animals is a fundraising and awareness initiative that supports needy animals.

Negotiations Underway Between il Canale & Cannon's Fish Market

The owners of il Canale, georgetown, and Cannon’s Fish Market are in preliminary negotiations for il Canale to take-over Cannon’s closed space on 31st Street near the C&O Canal, The Georgetown Dish has independently confirmed.

Celebrate Scottish Heritage at Dumbarton House

Dumbarton House got its name from the Rock of Dumbarton, located near Glasgow, Scotland.

The First Mayoral Event of the Season is History

Petitions to place your name on the April 1, 2014 primary ballot for Mayor were available to be picked up on Friday, November 8th and it took only five days for the DC Bar to hold the first mayoral debate of the season.

8th Annual Georgetown Jingle at Four Seasons December 15

The 8th Annual Georgetown Jingle will take place on December 15, 2013, at Four Seasons Hotel Washington, DC.
Sneak Peek: Washington Design Center's New Digs

Doubts Loom Over Heating Plant Demolition

By Elizabeth WienerCurrent Staff Writer
WFP Lists 19th Century Restored Logan Circle Home

Walking This Way

Washington Redskins backup QB Kirk Cousins, Pierre Garcon, Kai Forbath, Fred Davis, and former ‘Skins Gary Clark and Fred Smoot walked a fashion runway for an event at the Italian embassy sponsored by Bec

M Squared Shows Historic Georgetown Home

M Squared Real Estate is having a preview and cocktail reception in Georgetown at 3326 N Street Wednesday, November 13 from 5:00 to 8:00 pm.

Nancy Pelosi Views Machiavelli Exhibit at Italian Embassy

Image

Victorian Tea at Tudor Place November 16

On Saturday, November 16th, from 1:00 to 3:00 pm., enjoy a traditional Victorian tea complete with tea sandwiches, scones, delicious desserts and historic tea blends in a beautiful 1870s Georgetown house - Tudor Place.
Bonhams Hosts Preview of The Rau Collection Auction at The Cosmos Club

Las Vegas: In Search of Real

I was looking for seedy. Or, sketchy. At least something real.

Galleries 1054 Opening Reception at Sea Catch November 15

Located in Canal Square - Georgetown's oldest enclave of art galleries located along the historic C&O Canal - join Galleries 1054, including Alla Rogers Gallery, MOCA DC, Winter Palace Studio and Georgetown's newest gallery,

Veterans Day Weekend Events in DC

Some interesting things to do this weekend include seeingstand-up comedian John Oliver at Warner Theatre.

K Silve 'Found Meditations' at Susan Calloway Through November 16

K Silve’s intuitive and deliberate acrylic paintings unfold through layers of lush colors, aggressive brushwork and drips which push and pull off the sides of her canvases. Her paintings are based on momentary synaesthetic impressions of interactions with nature.

Kevin Spacey Talks Politics at GU

Monday evening, Oscar-winning actor Kevin Spacey was in town and at Georgetown University with former White House politico and Georgetown government faculty member Ron Klain to to talk about ethics, power and politics.

ANC Skeptical of Heating Plan Project

By Brady HoltCurrent Staff Writer

Plans to demolish much of Georgetown’s West Heating Plant faced opposition Monday, with the area’s advisory neighborhood commission unanimously objecting to key aspects of the proposal.

Katherine on The Daily Show with Jon Stewart

“It Does A Body Bad?”
Marcos Galvany Produces 'Oh My Son' Limited Edition CD

City Tavern Club Hosts Capital City Ball November 23

Join City Tavern Club in Georgetown for an elegant and fun black-tie gala - the 2013 Capital City Ball - on Saturday, November 23rd.

DC, I Love You

They say absence makes the heart go fonder. That is certainly true for me… after almost three weeks on the road, with 12 hours here and there in DC, I got back last night for what is going to be 4 days here straight, and remembered the many reasons why I love DC so much.

Roberta Gambarini at Blues Alley

Celebrated throughout the world by fans, critics and many of the world's greatest musicians, Italian-born jazz singer, Roberta Gambarini became a fast rising star and Grammy® Nominee with the 2006 release of her debut album Easy to Love.
It’s Not Too Late to Give: AIDS Walk 2013

Cheers to Peroni Beer in the Little Italy Neighborhood of Georgetown

Peroni's 50th Anniversary will be celebrated with a FREE BEER for patrons at il Canale, Georgetown, Sunday through Thursday during the entire month of November.

Georgetown Benetton Celebrates New Autumn & Winter Collection

Wednesday night, Washington VIPs and style-setters were treated to an exclusive glimpse of the United Colors of Benetton Autumn/Winter 2013 collection at the Georgetown flagship store.

Swedish Fashion Photography at House of Sweden

Different Distances: Fashion Photography Goes Art, a compelling exhibition of photography by five internationally renowned Swedish photographers is being presented by the Embassy of Sweden at the House of Sweden now through December 8th, Saturday and Sun

Incredible Edible Herbs from the Dumbarton House Garden

Herbs and flowers have long been used for medicine, cooking and comfort. On Sunday, November 3rd, from 1:00 to 3:00 pm., in Dumbarton House's Belle Vue Ballroom, explore and learn about herbs used in the Federal period and grown in Dumbarton House's period herb garden.

Plan Calls for Streetcar Line Under Whitehurst

By Katie PearceCurrent Staff Writer

A new streetcar line has emerged as the best option for linking Georgetown to Union Station, according to a final D.C. Department of Transportation report on “premium transit” options for the corridor.

WFP Lists Georgetown Penthouse

Washington Fine Properties (WFP) is currently offering a one-of-a-kind penthouse with 4BR, 4.5BA and two-car garage parking in historic Georgetown. Exquisite, custom-built duplex penthouse in the most sought after location on Prospect Street.

Still the Best Crêpe in Paris?

Whenever in Paris, I love to visit Rue Cler – a quaint area of the city in the 7th arrondissement.

Center for American Progress Celebrates 10 Years

Last Thursday the Center for American Progress (CAP) celebrated their 10th anniversary with a day-long conference and an evening reception.
